sentences.en: Adapt to treat dermatophytosis , athlete's foot and feet tickle.
sentences.cn: 适用于脚气、脚癣、脚痒等真菌感染.

sentences.en: As the intensity increased the sensation changed from tickle to pain.
sentences.cn: 随着强度的增加,感觉从发痒变为疼痛.

sentences.en: He felt a tickle on the back of her neck.
sentences.cn: 他感到她颈部的一阵酥痒感.

sentences.en: I am tickle pink at the news.
sentences.cn: 听到这消息我高兴得要命.

sentences.en: I don't like these rough sheets. They tickle.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢这些粗糙的床单. 它们使人发痒.

sentences.en: I was tickled pink by the compliment.
sentences.cn: 我对赞扬之词感到喜悦

sentences.en: I was tickled to discover that we'd both done the same thing.
sentences.cn: 我高兴地发现我俩在做同样的事。

sentences.en: I'll give you a tickle if you laugh at me.
sentences.cn: 你再笑话我,我可要挠你痒了.

sentences.en: If something's bothering you, get it off your chest and tickle your [ the ] mind.
sentences.cn: 有什么不痛快的事, 就把它说出来,你心里也就 敞亮 了.

sentences.en: Mazie’s fur collar was tickling her neck.
sentences.cn: 马齐耶的毛领子扎得她脖子痒痒的。

sentences.en: Mommy, this blanket tickles.
sentences.cn: 妈妈，这毛毯扎人。

sentences.en: Philosophy's queerest arguments tickle agreeably our sense of subtlety and ingenuity.
sentences.cn: 哲学上最奇怪的议点也会愉快地引起我们微妙机敏的感觉.

sentences.en: Stop tickling me!
sentences.cn: 别挠我痒痒！

sentences.en: The baby laughed when I gave her a tickle.
sentences.cn: 我呵婴孩痒,婴孩笑了.

sentences.en: The bigger girls used to chase me and tickle me.
sentences.cn: 比我高大的女孩过去总是追赶着胳肢我。

sentences.en: The little girl laughed when her uncle gave her a tickle.
sentences.cn: 叔叔呵那个小姑娘的痒时,小姑娘笑起来.

sentences.en: They're more likely to tickle us!
sentences.cn: 它们更可能要摸我们呢!

sentences.en: This morning I got the old tickle in the throat.
sentences.cn: 今天早晨我感到喉咙里发痒.

sentences.en: This selective perception is probably the reason why we cannot tickle ourselves.
sentences.cn: 这种选择性的知觉或许就是我们无法自己哈痒的原因.

sentences.en: Wilson was feeling restless. There was a tickle in his throat.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊只觉得心神不定. 嗓子眼里有些发痒.

words.tran_cn: 不安定的，不稳定的；难对付的；易倒的；易痒的；忌讳的
滴答响的东西；自动收报机；钟表；断续器
难题；使人痒的东西或人；备忘录；使人高兴的人或物

trans.tran_en: a feeling in your throat that makes you want to cough
to move your fingers on a sensitive part of sb's body in a way that makes them laugh
to move your fingers gently over someone’s body in order to make them laugh
if something touching your body tickles you, it makes you want to rub your body because it is slightly uncomfortable

trans.tran_cn: （使）发痒，（使）愉快，逗乐，使高兴，使满足
